subject: RE: [junit] class not found exception
msgSnippet: Suresh, I noticed you are referencing a src directory in the test name directory. Are your class files also located in this directory?  If your test class is
messageBody:
Suresh,

I noticed you are referencing a 'src' directory in the test name directory.
Are your class files also located in this directory? If your test class is
not in the specified directory, then this error message would appear.

Hope this helps.

mark

-----Original Message-----
From: suresh [mailto:jsdk00@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 26, 2002 12:54 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] class not found exception


hi i am trying to run a Junit test case from the ant script and i got
following error. All my files are placed in d:\src directory without
any package names. TempTest is name of the class. any suggestions
please ?

<junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes" haltonfailure="no">
<formatter type="plain"/>
<test name="D:/src/TempTest" outfile="result">
</test>
</junit>

</target>

error message:
Testsuite: D:/src/TempTest
Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec

Caused an ERROR
D:/src/TempTest
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: D:/src/TempTest
at java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method)
at java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:115)
